intro: Crotalaria tsavoana, commonly known as the Tsavo crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. The plant typically grows in dry, arid environments and is well adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces distinctive seed pods that split open when mature. The species is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in soil enrichment and potential medicinal applications.
